message.content:
Analysis of the Main Target Image
--------------------------------
There are two separate “towers” in the scene:

• Tower A (left tower)  
  – Total of 4 blocks stacked in 4 layers.  
    1) Bottom layer: A red arch block.  
    2) Second layer: A green rectangular block placed horizontally on top of the arch.  
    3) Third layer: A single blue cube centered above the green rectangle.  
    4) Top layer: An orange roof‐shaped block sitting atop the blue cube.  

• Tower B (right tower)  
  – Total of 3 blocks arranged in 2 layers.  
    1) Bottom layer: A red arch block.  
    2) Second layer: Two cubes side by side, with the blue cube on the left and the yellow cube on the right.  

Thus, the overall scene uses 7 blocks in total (4 for Tower A and 3 for Tower B).

Selection of Required Blocks
----------------------------
From the block dictionary (second image), the following indices and orientations match exactly:

• Red arch (with arch opening front‐to‐back): Index 1  
  – Used twice (one for each tower base).  
• Green rectangular block (horizontal orientation): Index 10  
  – Used once, for the middle layer of Tower A.  
• Blue cube: Index 6  
  – Used twice (one in Tower A, one in Tower B).  
• Yellow cube: Index 9  
  – Used once, in the top layer of Tower B alongside the blue cube.  
• Orange roof‐shaped block: Index 13  
  – Used once, for the top of Tower A.

Assembly Order
--------------
Below is a possible step‐by‐step sequence to assemble both towers:

{
  Step1: Move block with index 1   // Base arch for Tower A
  Step2: Move block with index 10  // Green rectangle on top of Tower A arch
  Step3: Move block with index 6   // Blue cube on Tower A
  Step4: Move block with index 13  // Orange roof on Tower A
  Step5: Move block with index 1   // Base arch for Tower B
  Step6: Move block with index 6   // Blue cube on Tower B (left position)
  Step7: Move block with index 9   // Yellow cube on Tower B (right position)
}
